page.title: 13Blacksmith, Haltwhistle
page.content: There has always been a blacksmith's shop in Haltwhistle market square. In the past the blacksmiths travelled around the district shoeing horses and repairing cartwheels. Even today many farmers rely on the local blacksmith to do simple repairs and were dismayed when the blacksmith was retiring with no-one to replace him. Fortunately this link with the past was not lost and a buyer was found who was willing to carry on the business and retain the well known name of Jackson. The shop carries a full stock of tools and ironmongery, but it is still possible for a farmer to take his tractor to the blacksmith to be repaired, or a housewife to order new fire bars for an obsolete fireplace, a pair of iron gates and have a new bottom put in her brass coal skuttle.
